page.title: 15STOKE PRIOR, NEAR BROMSGROVE
page.content: {Stoke Prior}is a village south of the town of{Bromsgrove}(in the county of Hereford and Worcester) where most people go to do their shopping.There is the Birmingham{canal}that goes through the middle of the village and a{railway}which goes from Bristol to Birmingham. We have a police station and shops and a butchers in Ryefields Road as well as a playing field.There is a school and a man called{John {Corbett}built it in 1872. He repaired the church and he is buried in the churchyard. We call John Corbett the {'Salt King'}because he found{salt under Stoke Prior and he owned the old salt works. We have lots of factory units and lots of people work in them. We have many different types of houses but most of them are semi-detached and town houses. We have a football team, cubs, scouts,brownies and guides.
